cellularAutomata.util.files
Class CARuleDescriptionLoader

java.lang.Object
  cellularAutomata.util.files.CARuleDescriptionLoader

public class CARuleDescriptionLoader
extends java.lang.Object

Loads html files stored in the CA Explorer's "ruleDescriptions" folder.

Author:
David Bahr

Constructor Detail

CARuleDescriptionLoader

public CARuleDescriptionLoader()
Method Detail

getURL

public static java.net.URL getURL(java.lang.String name)
Gets the url to the specified file which lives in the "ruleDescriptions" folder.

Parameters:
name - The name of the html file (if the html file is in a subfolder of the "ruleDescriptions" folder, then include the subfolder (for example, "subfolder/filename.html").
Returns:
The URL, or null if the path does not work.

getURLFromRuleClassName

public static java.net.URL getURLFromRuleClassName(java.lang.String ruleClassName)
Gets the URL of the html description using the supplied class name for the rule.

Parameters:
ruleClassName - The name of the class of the rule.
Returns:
The URL to the html description of the rule, or null if the path does not work.

getURLFromRuleName

public static java.net.URL getURLFromRuleName(java.lang.String ruleDisplayName)
Gets the URL of the html description using the supplied descriptive rule name (for example, "Life", or "Rule 102", etc).

Parameters:
ruleDisplayName - The descriptive name of the rule which is used for display purposes (like "Life" or "Rule 102").
Returns:
The URL to the html description of the rule, or null if the path does not work.

getHTMLFromRuleDisplayName

public static java.lang.String getHTMLFromRuleDisplayName(java.lang.String ruleDisplayName)
Gets the specified html file associated with the specified rule.

Parameters:
ruleDisplayName - The descriptive name of the rule which is used for display purposes (like "Life" or "Rule 102").
Returns:
The html description associated with the given rule. Null if not available.

getHTMLWithExtraLineBreaksFromRuleDisplayName

public static java.lang.String getHTMLWithExtraLineBreaksFromRuleDisplayName(java.lang.String ruleDisplayName)
Gets the specified html file associated with the specified rule, and it adds break line tags after every paragraph tag. This allows JLabels (like tool tips) and JButtons to display html properly.

Parameters:
ruleDisplayName - The descriptive name of the rule which is used for display purposes (like "Life" or "Rule 102").
Returns:
The html description associated with the given rule, with extra line breaks for proper display on JLabels (like tool tips). Null if not available.
